sen.j: 五条通（ごじょうどおり）は京都市の主要な東西の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Gojo-dori Street is one of the major east-west running streets in Kyoto City.
Gojo-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.
Gojo-dori Street is one of the major east-west streets in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Overview
Overview
Overview

sen.j: 都市の中心部を東西に貫き、ほとんどの区間で一般国道に指定されている主要幹線である。
sen.e: The street, running east and west through the center of the city, is main arterial highway with most of the section designated as general national highways.
The street, which runs east and west through the center of the city, is the main arterial highway with most of the section designated as a general national highway.
The street, which runs east and west through the center of the city, is the main arterial highway with most of the section designated as a general national highway.

sen.j: 国道の名称としては堀川五条以東は国道1号であり、烏丸五条以西は国道9号（烏丸五条-堀川五条は国道1号と重複）である。
sen.e: The east of Horikawa Gojo is National Highway Route 1 and the west of Karasumaru Gojo is National Highway route No.9 (The section between.Karasuma Gojo and Horikawa Gojo is shared by National Highway Route No. 1.

The east of Horikawa Gojo is National Highway Route No. 1, and the west of Karasumaru Gojo is National Highway Route No. 9 (the section between.Karasuma Gojo and Horikawa Gojo is shared with National Highway Route No. 1).

The east of Horikawa Gojo is National Highway Route No. 1, and the west of Karasumaru Gojo is National Highway Route No. 9 (the section between Karasuma Gojo and Horikawa Gojo is shared with National Highway Route No. 1).

sen.j: また国道8号（烏丸五条以東）、国道162号（天神川五条-西大路五条）の重複区間でもある。
sen.e: Also it is shared by the National Highway Route No. 8 (east of Karasuam Gojo) and National Highway Route No.162 (between Tenjin Gojo and Nishioji Gojo).
Additionally, it is shared by National Highway Route No. 8 (east of Karasuma Gojo) and National Highway Route No. 162 (between Tenjin Gojo and Nishioji Gojo).
Additionally, it is shared by National Highway Route No. 8 (east of Karasuma Gojo) and National Highway Route No. 162 (between Tenjingawa Gojo and Nishioji Gojo).

sen.j: 通りの東は東大路通との交差点である五条坂交差点付近から五条坂と呼ばれる。
sen.e: In the east, the street starting around Gojozaka Crossing with the Higashioji-dori Street is called Gojozaka.
In the east, the street starting around Gojozaka Crossing with Higashioji-dori Street is called Gojozaka.
In the east, the street starting around Gojozaka Crossing with Higashioji-dori Street is called Gojozaka.

sen.j: 五条坂交差点からは清水寺に向かう細い道となり、松原通（松原通の東端部）と合流する。
sen.e: The street from Gojozaka crossing is narrow toward Kiyomizudera Temple and merges with the Matsubara-dori Street (at the eastern end of the Matsubara-dori Street).
The street from Gojozaka Crossing is narrow toward Kiyomizudera Temple and merges with Matsubara-dori Street (at the eastern end of Matsubara-dori Street).
The street from Gojozaka Crossing is narrow toward Kiyomizu-dera Temple but merges with Matsubara-dori Street (at the eastern end of Matsubara-dori Street).
sen.cmt: ハイフン挿入し他の記事と統一

sen.j: なお、国道1号は東大路通を立体交差で越えて五条バイパスとなり、渋谷通と合流して東山 (京都府)を越え山科盆地へ続く(この山科区における五条バイパスも含めて、ひろく五条通と呼ばれることもある)。
sen.e: National Highway Route No. 1, after crossing over the Higashioji-dori Street, becomes the Gojo Bypass, merges with the Shibuya-dori Street, runs across Higashiyama (Kyoto Prefecture), and continues to Yamashina Basin. (The Gojo Bypass running in Yamashina Ward may be widely referred to as the Gojo-dori Street.)

National Highway Route No. 1, after crossing over Higashioji-dori Street, becomes the Gojo Bypass, merges with Shibuya-dori Street, runs across Higashiyama (Kyoto Prefecture) and continues to Yamashina Basin (the Gojo Bypass running in Yamashina ward is widely referred to as Gojo-dori Street.)

National Highway Route No. 1, after it crosses Higashioji-dori Street, becomes the Gojo Bypass, merges with Shibutani-dori Street, runs through Higashiyama (Kyoto Prefecture) and continues to Yamashina Basin (the Gojo Bypass running in Yamashina Ward is widely referred to as Gojo-dori Street).

sen.j: 西は国道9号として、桂川 (淀川水系)の西大橋を経て桂から京都縦貫自動車道沓掛インターチェンジに繋がる。
sen.e: In the west, the street, as National Highway Route No.9, crosses the Nishiohashi Bridge, goes to Katsura, and leads to Kutsukake Interchange of Kyoto Jukan Jidoshado Expressway.
In the west the street, designated as National Highway Route No. 9, crosses the Nishiohashi Bridge, goes to Katsura and leads to the Kutsukake Interchange of the Kyoto Jukan Jidoshado Expressway.

In the west the street, designated as National Highway Route No. 9, crosses the Nishiohashi Bridge of Katsura River (Yodo-gawa water system), goes to Katsura and leads to the Kutsukake Interchange of the Kyoto Jukan Jidoshado Expressway.
sen.cmt: of Katsura River (Yodo-gawa water system)補足

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 平安京の六条坊門小路にあたる。
sen.e: The street corresponds to the Rokujo-bomon-koji Street in Heiankyo.
The street corresponds to Rokujo-bomon-koji Street in Heiankyo.
The street corresponds to Rokujo-bomon-koji Street in Heiankyo.

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉が、方広寺参拝のため、鴨川 (淀川水系)に架かる五条大橋を六条坊門小路に移設したため、この通りが五条通となった。
sen.e: The street started to be called the Gojo-dori street because Gojo-ohashi Bridge crossing across the Kamogawa-River (Yodogawa water system) was moved to the Rokujo-bomon-koji Street by Hideyoshi Toyotomi, who wanted to visit Hokoji Temple.

It was originally called Gojo-dori Street because the Gojo-ohashi Bridge crossing the Kamogawa-River (Yodogawa water system) was moved to Rokujo-bomon-koji Street by Hideyoshi Toyotomi, who wanted to visit Hokoji Temple.

It was originally called Gojo-dori Street because the Gojo-ohashi Bridge crossing the Kamo-gawa River (Yodo-gawa water system) was moved to Rokujo-bomon-koji Street by Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI, who wanted to visit Hoko-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: Kamogawa-River→Kamo-gawa River 他の記事とあわせる。Yodogawa→Yodo-gawaToyotomi→TOYOTOMIHokoji→Hoko-ji

sen.j: 元の五条大路は松原通と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: The former Gojo-oji Street began to be called Matsubara Street.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The former Gojo-oji Street began to be called Matsubara Street.
The former Gojo-oji Street began to be called Matsubara Street.

sen.j: 唱歌「牛若丸」の歌い出しには「京の五条の橋の上」とあり、現在の五条大橋の西詰、五条通の中央分離帯に牛若丸と弁慶の像が置かれている。
sen.e: "Ushiwakamaru," the school song starts with “on a bridge of Gojo in Kyoto,” and the statues of Ushiwakamaru and Benkei stand at the west end of the Gojo-ohashi Bridge and on the median strip of the street.

The school anthem "Ushiwakamaru" begins with “on a bridge of Gojo in Kyoto,” and the statues of Ushiwakamaru and Benkei stand at the western end of the Gojo-ohashi Bridge and on the median strip of the street.

The school anthem 'Ushiwakamaru' begins with, 'On a bridge of Gojo in Kyoto,' and the statues of Ushiwakamaru and Benkei stand at the western end of the Gojo-ohashi Bridge and on the median strip of the street.

sen.j: なお、牛若丸と弁慶の時代の五条大橋は、元の五条大路である松原通の方に架かる橋にあたるため、時代考証上の不備のように思われるが、牛若丸と弁慶の出会いはもともと五条大橋とは別の場所であったものを、後年作り話として「五条の橋の上」と設定したものに過ぎない。
sen.e: Considering that the Gojo-ohashi Bridge in the era of Ushiwakamaru and Benkei were located on the former Gojo-oji Street, the present-day Matsubara-dori Street, historical evidence may not be properly examined, but the encounter of Ushiwakamaru with Benkei on the Gojo-ohashi Bridge, which in fact occurred in different place, may have been a story made up.

Considering that the Gojo-ohashi Bridge in the era of Ushiwakamaru and Benkei was located on the former Gojo-oji Street (the present-day Matsubara-dori Street), the historical evidence may not be properly examined, but the encounter of Ushiwakamaru with Benkei on Gojo-ohashi Bridge, which in fact occurred in a different place, may have been a contrived tale.

Considering that the Gojo-ohashi Bridge in the era of Ushiwakamaru and Benkei was located on the former Gojo-oji Street (the present-day Matsubara-dori Street), the historical evidence may not be properly examined, but the encounter of Ushiwakamaru with Benkei on Gojo-ohashi Bridge, which in fact occurred in a different place, may have been a contrived tale.

sen.j: 東大路通から千本通までの区間は御池通や堀川通同様、第二次世界大戦末期に防火帯形成のため建物疎開が行われ、戦後、その用地を利用して幅員約50mに道路が整備された。
sen.e: During World War II, houses along the section between Higashioji Street and Senbon-dori Street were forced to move to build a fire blocking belt, like in the Horikawa-dori Street; after the war, the street were widened to about 50 meter using the site.

During World War II, houses along the section between Higashioji Street and Senbon-dori Street were forced to move in order to build a fire-blocking belt, like in Horikawa-dori Street; however, after the war, the street was widened to about 50 meters using the site.

During World War II, houses along the section between Higashioji Street and Senbon-dori Street were forced to move in order to build a fire-blocking belt, like in Oike-dori Street and Horikawa-dori Street; however, after the war, the street was widened to about 50 meters using the site.

sen.j: 現在、西大路通まで50mに拡幅する工事が事業中である。
sen.e: Now road widening works are under way to extend 50 meter wide lanes to the Nishioji-dori Street.
Road-widening work is now under way to extend the 50-meter-wide lanes to Nishioji-dori Street.
Road-widening work is now under way to extend the 50-meter-wide lanes to Nishioji-dori Street.

sen.j: 交差する道路などの特記がないものは市町村道。
sen.e: Roads unless specified are operated by local municipalities.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise specified.
Roads are operated by local municipalities unless otherwise specified.
